concept.title: Opening and Closing the Restaurant
concept.shortdesc: Navigating Shared Responsibilities of Restaurant Upkeep

conbody.p: See the following sections for more information on our standard operating procedures.

section.title: Overview
section.p: Everyone is likely to open or close at some point. These instructions are a guide for those times when you will have to perform either activity.

section.title: Opening
section.p: Opening the restaurant will focus on getting items ready for the day ahead. Much of what needs to be done for a day will be completed throughout the course of the day. Don't worry about doing everything! Your job at open is to help provide for the day moving as smoothly as possible.

section.title: Closing
section.p: Closing the restaurant will focus on cleanup and organization. Your job is to leave a clean and neat restaurant for the next day's workers. Tasks such as food prep and mopping the floors will ensure that the restaurant is ready for its next set of challenges. We can't watch the restaurant constantly, so we need to provide for those hours when we won't be there.

section.title: When do I open/close?
section.p: If you are scheduled for first shift, you will be opening the restaurant. If you are scheduled for third or fourth shift, you will be closing the restaurant. Additionally, if you are marked for "closer" on the schedule, then you will be the one to lock up the restaurant on that day.

section.title: How do I know what to do?
section.p: The specifics of opening and closing the restaurant will be listed in their specific sections. See "Opening Procedure" and "Closing Procedure" respectively. If you have questions, speak with your supervisor. It is expected that all employees work together towards the completion of these tasks. Respect and a sense of team spirit are important to Four Seasons Restaurant. Help one another as you would have each other help you. When we work together, we can get things done much more easily and much faster!
